Power & All Abilities | Solo Leveling Menu Home Anime & Manga Attack on Titan Black Clover Dr. Stone Jujutsu Kaisen Kengan Omega My Hero Academia One Piece Webtoon Noblesse Solo Leveling Tower of God K-Drama Top 10s Who is Sung Jin-Woo? Power & All Abilities | Solo Leveling February 12, 2024 by Jiyad Shaikh Solo Leveling is a renowned South Korean manga web novel by Chu-Gong. The novel was later adapted into a webtoon illustrated by Jang Sung-Rak. Exploring distinctive themes related to fantasies and the dark realm where monster-like creatures reside provides the narrative with a dynamic allure. The series’s main protagonist appears to be a typical human being; after discovering a system, his life undergoes a drastic change. This article will examine the depths of the series’ main protagonist, Sung Jin-Woo. Although the followers of Solo Leveling are already familiar with Jin-Woo’s abilities and powers , through this article, we are diving deep into this character and taking a close peek. Who is Sung Jin-Woo in Solo Leveling? Sung Jin-Woo is the central character portrayed as a protagonist in the series, around whom the story revolves. It all begins with the introductory phase of Jin-Woo as an E-Rank Hunter, usually considered weak, contrasting this with becoming the strongest in the Solo Leveling universe. He is comparable to a typical protagonist, starting with a weak depiction and then getting stronger through rigorous training as the story unfolds. Jin-Woo, back in the days when he was weak, used to be a short, skinny guy with hair long enough to cover his ears. His facial structure was also odd in that he looked way younger than his actual age, seeming even younger than his sister, Jinah. Everything changed after an event occurred in his life, leading to significant changes. I. How Sung Jin-Woo Gains New Power and Abilities Initially, Sung Jin-Woo, the protagonist, was an E-Rank Hunter with minimal strength and was notably less influential in the Hunter community. This thing comes to a halt soon after JIn-Woo is chosen by the System, a peculiar magical program that only he can access. The system allowed him to grow stronger by elevating his strength in every way possible, without restraint. Subsequently, Jin-Woo senses it as an advantage, eventually growing strong enough to earn the status of humanity’s most excellent hunter and the decisive second Shadow Monarch. In addition to this, he also develops an iconic ability, “Shadow Extraction.” This ability allows him to turn the defeated opponents into his loyal soldiers. It does not end here; despite already being immensely strong, these shadows kept getting even more substantial as Jin-Woo grew stronger. II. His Powers Jin-Woo, in his developmental phase, undergoes versatile changes and amplified transformation. As he levels himself up, he eventually becomes the most excellent hunter. Let’s dig into his character more and understand him comprehensively. -> Tremendous Strength After the system bestows its powers upon Jin-Woo, he gains significant strength. Even before obtaining his powers, he could punch a massive hole through the face of the Statue of God; subsequently, he became stronger. This becomes more compelling when Thomas Andre, who is one of the National Level Hunters in the series, is defeated by Jin-Woo. Jin-Woo surpasses him with ease. Jin-Woo has proven his worth as humanity’s most excellent hunter several times. However, notably, by the end of the series, he maxes out his strength, speed, and stamina, unveiling a new aspect of the story. Such enormous progress makes him one tough guy to fight, quickly becoming invincible against his opponents with years of training and battle experience. -> Immense Speed Jin-Woo’s super speed is undoubtedly a spectacular and practical sight. He appears to be so fast that even his opponents have a hard time tracking his movements. Apparently, during his confrontation with the Frost Monarch, he overpowers the beat in terms of speed. He moves with incredible speed, swiftly slicing the hand of the Shadow Monarch. It was a massive loss for the beast, as he could not discern the intense attack and remained still. It was only after his limb fell off that he acknowledged it. This is just one instance where Jin-Woo showcases his speed of attacks and his grasp over his skills; however, there are still many incidents where he proves his lightning speed. Possessing such overwhelming powers establishes him as a feared opponent among his foes. -> Robust Endurance He is comparably a tank, taking hits like they are nothing to him. Considering his encounter with the Ant King, JinWoo’s durability becomes evident, barely flinching to the punch right in his face. This suggests his strength and displays his resilience to such lethal hits. Another instance where he demonstrates why the series revolves around him can be traced back to his confrontation with the architect. During the brutal battle between these two superhuman beings, JIn-Woo apparently shocks everyone by giving up and returning with the same strength even after suffering severe wounds. Such remarkable endurance and a never-giving-up attitude not only demonstrate his physical capabilities but also underscore his suitability for the role of the strongest hunter. Follow Us on Telegram III. His Abilities -> Shadow Extraction It is one of the iconic and noteworthy abilities that Jin-Woo possesses. The Shadow Extraction technique allows our guy to revive a beast or hunter he defeats. He can summon the dead beings’ souls as overwhelmingly strong shadows. This technique is activated through a predefined keyword without risking losing mana in its utilization. The best part is its effective range, which can be applied over a large radius. The user here, Jin-Woo, can extract shadows on a considerable scale—hundreds simultaneously. He has an army of these powerful beings, the shadow army. Jin-Woo has numerous shadows under his command, giving him an upper hand in his battles. -> Regenerative Healing Factor Along with the explosive growth in his physical strength, Jin-Woo also develops a healing ability. This ability to regenerate helps him recover from several severe injuries and physical traumas. The efficacy of this technique evolves as he levels up, eventually complementing his physical prowess and granting him an advantage over his adversaries. In other words, it can be described as a trump card, bestowing Jin Woo with the ability to return to normal instantly after injuries. Such a game-changing ability is one of the iconic possessions in solo leveling. His regenerative ability becomes a prominent and significant aspect of his toughness, establishing him as an intimidating yet exciting protagonist. -> Shadow Exchange and Dimensional Travel It extends Jin-Woo Shadow Extraction. The Shadow Exchange ability allows Jin-woo to swap his location with any of his shadows at his woll, regardless of the distance they are located. A glimpse of his Shadow Exchange ability was demonstrated when a menacing monster attacked and almost killed his sister. He swiftly swaps with the shadow he assigned to guard his sister, averting potential tragedy. By the end of the series, he becomes capable enough to enhance this ability into a dimensional proficiency. In other words, he could create gates or simply portals, enabling him to travel to any location within the universe. These “gates” can be so massive, fitting thousands. IV. How Powerful Sung Jin-Woo I s In Solo Leveling Although initially he was just a regular guy, as soon as he underwent drastic transformations, he never turned back again. As the series ends, Jin-Woo achieves mastery over his shadows and mana. He even reaches a state where he becomes invincible and has unparalleled potency, enhancing all his attributes—strength, speed, stamina, and magic—to their maximum potential. This acceleration in his powers and abilities sets him apart from the rest and makes him an unbeatable opponent for his foes. Being the “Shadow Monarch,” he attains an immense boost, surpassing those of the strongest hunters in the world of solo leveling. V. Why is Sung Jin-Woo the chosen one? Originally, Sung Jin-woo was an E-Rank Hunter, but he was chosen by Ashburn, the original Shadow Monarch, to be a successor. This event changed Jin-Woo’s life dramatically, granting him abilities to elevate his strength. The architect tries to find a new body for Ashborn to inhabit, but Jin-Woo grows unexpectedly strong, which is a hurdle. Subsequently, Jin-Woo defeats the architect and Asborndenies to get reincarnated into Jin-Woo’s body, giving him all of his powers as a successor. CONCLUSION In conclusion, Sung Jin-Woo’s character endures notable changes in his life. From being a regular weak individual to becoming the strongest character in Solo Leveling, Jin-Woo proved his worth as the series’ main character. Despite this, it is essential to note that he only establishes himself through his exquisite determination and struggles. The depiction of Sung Jin-Woo is remarkable, as the series’ journey keeps leveling him up, resulting in his transformation into an absolute beast. Do small things with great love. However, one may wonder what exactly makes our leveling-up hero Jinwoo the strongest of all in the world of Solo Leveling. Well, let’s discuss Jinwoo’s powers and abilities in detail to get an answer to that question. Spoilers Warning This article contains heavy spoilers about the shadows of Sung Jinwoo. Thus, we highly suggest you to read the manhwa completely beforehand in order to avoid ruining your intended experience. Sung Jinwoo’s Powers and Abilities Jinwoo started out as an average human being who can’t even defeat a low-tier monster, let alone Monarch or Rulers. However, by the end of the manhwa, Jinwoo basically becomes a God. Every protagonist holds immense strength or speed, but Jinwoo has multiple powers and abilities in his arsenal. He not only transforms into the strongest Solo Leveling Hunter with these powers, but he also becomes the strongest being in the entire world. 1. Superhuman Strength Image Credit: A-1 Pictures (via X/sololeveling_en) Being Sung II Hwan’s son, how can Jinwoo not be born with the immense physical strength that helped him damage the Statue of God before getting chosen by the System? However, the boy never really knew his true potential and spent his early days as one of the lowest-skilled E-ranked hunters. After nearly getting killed in the double dungeon and getting chosen by the System, Jinwoo sees an immeasurable evolvement in his physical strength. Jinwoo’s strength was evidently strong when he fought Igris . Even though Igris was more experienced in battle, Jinwoo was able to overwhelm the other-world entity with his kicks and punches. Another example of Jinwoo’s strength was his fight against enemies like Rakan and Antares. He defeated the Beast Monarch in just four punches. On the other hand, he was able to survive and even beat Antares, the strongest of Monarch, with his strength. 2. Lightning Fast Speed Strength isn’t the only strong suit of Jinwoo, as the character also flaunts incredible speed. In the fight against Rakan, Jinwoo attacked at such a superhuman speed that even the Monarch couldn’t track the Hunter’s movements. Jinwoo is already faster than the speed of light (by the end of the manhwa), but the System allows the character to go even further by increasing his speed by 30%. Related Articles 10 Best Solo Leveling Arcs (Ranked) Ajith Kumar Apr 15, 2024 12 Strongest Solo Leveling Characters, Ranked Aparna Ukil Apr 8, 2024 3. Incredible Regeneration Ability With strength and speed comes Jinwoo’s incredible regeneration ability. The System allows him to regenerate and overcome his injuries at a godly speed. There are also multiple healing items in Jinwoo’s inventory that he can use during a battle to replenish his stamina or heal his body. Also, let’s not forget that Jinwoo is also immune to all forms of poison or illness, all thanks to Ashborn’s powers. 4. Incredible Fighting Skills Image Credit: A-1 Pictures (via X/sololeveling_en) Jinwoo doesn’t have much experience in battle, but thanks to the System and his sheer will, the Hunter develops incredible fighting skills. Even before fully tapping into Ashborn’s powers, Jinwoo showed impressive fighting ability against Igris. He very smarty adapted to new strategy while fighting the opponent. He knew exactly when to use his dagger to block Igris’ sword attacks, and even in hand-to-hand combat, the Hunter was able to see through the enemy’s movements. Jinwoo realized that he’d have to fight a perfect balance between speed and strength to overcome Igris. Without even knowing his opponent and the extent of his abilities, Jinwoo was able to learn and adapt new fighting skills with his feet in the battle. 5. Gets Stronger After Every Fight Of course, everyone grows stronger after training, but Jinwoo had an RPG system backing him up. After completing a Dungeon and leveling up, Jinwoo used the points to grow stronger. He assigned those points to his strength, speed, weapons, agility, intelligence, etc. In short, the Hunter grows stronger after each completing each Guild or Gate. While there’s always a limit to how much a human can grow or learn, there is absolutely no limit to Jinwoo’s growth. He can basically become a God after exploiting the System to its full potential. 6. Access To Unlimited Weapons The System allows Jinwoo to access an inventory of unlimited weapons . After completing each Guild or simply leveling up, Jinwoo can unlock new abilities and weapons. While our hero uses the points to increase his strength, speed, or other physical traits quite often, he also uses the points to unlock new weapons or healing items. Guild maps, healing potions, and weapons such as the Knight Killer dagger are some of the items in Jinwoo’s inventory. And if that’s not enough, Jinwoo can also use the digital shop in the inventory to buy and sell items as per his needs. Also, he doesn’t need a physical bag to hold these items. If Jinwoo is done using his dagger, he can just put that back in his inventory digitally in the blink of an eye. Related Articles How Did Sung Jinwoo Become the Shadow Monarch in Solo Leveling? Ajith Kumar Mar 30, 2024 Solo Leveling: Sung Jinwoo’s Strongest Shadows, Ranked Ajith Kumar Jan 4, 2025 Who is Igris in Solo Leveling? Explained Ajith Kumar Mar 30, 2024 7. Shadow Extraction While many fear Shadows, Jinwoo embraces the darkness; in fact, he can use the Shadows to grow stronger. Jinwoo holds the power of Shadow Monarch , which allows him to mold the darkness to his liking. He can give physical form to Shadows. We have seen that when Jinwoo uses the Shadow to create a big armor , which also makes him look like Ashborn. Jinwoo also flaunts the Shadow Extraction for this exact reason. Control over Shadows allows the Hunter to resurrect anyone he defeats. Interestingly, Jinwoo creates a massive Shadow army by defeating countless enemies and making them his minions. It all started with Igris, and later on, we see Jinwoo extracting Hwan Dong-Su’s Shadow and renaming it “Greed.” We have also ranked Sung Jinwoo’s shadows in a dedicated guide, so check it out right here. That’s not it, though, as the control over Shadows allowed Jinwoo to swap places with his Shadows, or should we say teleport to a different location. If one of his Shadows is in the US and Jinwoo is in Korea, he can swap places with his Shadow and teleport to the US within a second. 8. A Being Beyond Time Image Credit: A-1 Pictures (via X/sololeveling_en) By the end of the manhwa, Jinwoo achieves Acausality as well. It means that our beloved Hunter transcends time and space. We all know that time is like a fabric, and while for humans, time only flows in one direction, for supernatural entities, time isn’t a foundation at all. For Jinwoo, there’s no past, present, and future . He exists in multiple timelines and will be unaffected if someone kills him by traveling to the past. Jinwoo will still exist in another timeline or future. In a sense, Jinwoo truly becomes immortal after achieving “Acausality.” 9. Complete Control Over Another Dimension Jinwoo becomes a God by the end of the story, and that is evident from the fact that he gets control over another dimension. This dimension, called Territory of Eternal Rest, is infinite in size, and only Jinwoo can access it or bring someone there. In this dimension, Jinwoo can alter anything simply through a thought. Basically, he can shape this world to his own liking. In the end, Sung Jinwoo becomes an immortal being who can’t be killed. On top of that, he becomes an Omnipotent being, proving that absolutely nobody is above him. #Tags #Solo Leveling Aparna Ukil Aparna is the Senior Entertainment Writer at Beebom. She started her professional journey in the retail industry but her admiration for films and TV shows pulled her into the field of entertainment writing where she has experience writing for various well-known publishers including Otakukart, Sportskeeda, Game Revolution, Forever Geek and Dexerto. Biography Appearance Personality Powers Weapons Profile Summary Full Name Alias Origin Occupation Powers/Skills Family Friends/Allies Shadows Who is Sung Jin Woo? Sung Jin-Woo (성진우, seongjin-wu) is the main character in the web novel Solo Leveling. He was formerly a very weak E-Rank Hunter, but when he was chosen as the Player of the System, he was given the chance of a lifetime and was given the power to grow stronger without limits. Jinwoo eventually ascended to power as humanity’s greatest hunter and the second Shadow Monarch by making use of the possibilities provided to him by the System. Biography Being the older brother of Sung Jin-Ah, Sung Jin-Woo is the oldest child of Sung Il-Hwan and Park Kyung-Hye. Soon after being awakened, his father, a firefighter, began entering the Dungeon to earn money, but he soon disappeared. After his mother was diagnosed with the Eternal Slumber Disease, Jin-Woo, a graduate, began working in the dungeons to help support his family and pay for his mother’s medical expenses while also caring for his younger sister. Appearance Sung Jin-Woo is a tall, good-looking young man with black hair, gray eyes, and angular features. His eyes glow vivid purple when he is using his abilities or when he is angry. He almost usually appears dressed in gloomy colors, especially black. Prior to this Jin-Woo wasn’t that good-looking and he wore basic clothing due to his lack of funds. However, everything changed when he was chosen by the System. Personality Jinwoo is a self-assured man with a strong sense of loyalty to his family and a desire to attain power. He loves his mother Park Kyung-Hye and sister Sung Jinah dearly. Furthermore, it should be emphasized that despite being the world’s strongest hunter, Jinwoo is not overly haughty and is friendly and kind in person. Powers Despite being an Awakened Human with physical prowess greater than that of other humans, Sung Jin-Woo was weaker than other Hunters of higher ranks and nearly died multiple times in lower-level dungeons. But after his Reawakening in the Double Dungeon, he became a Player and was able to level up and get stronger almost like a gamer. Since then, Jin-Woo has leveled up steadily by completing the many dungeons and unique ones to which he had exclusive access and developing his skills and powers by utilizing the System. Jinwoo, the Shadow Monarch’s vessel, is the world’s strongest hunter and far surpasses the raw power of the seven Rulers’ vessels. Therefore he possesses the following abilities below. Stealth Immense Strenght Quicksilver Armor Creation Mutilation Dragon’s Fear Unlimited Inventory Regenerative Healing Factor Bloodlust Dagger Rush Shadow Extraction Shadow Preservation Domain of the Monarch Ruler’s Authority Shadow Exchange Weapons Demon King’s Daggers: A pair of daggers that the Demon King Baran once wielded. It possesses a second ability called “Two as One,” which boosts each dagger’s attack power in accordance with the user’s strength stat. Demon King’s Longsword: A longsword that Baran once wielded. It possesses a second effect called Storm of White Flames that causes a tiny lightning storm to appear in the designated region. Kasaka’s Venom Fang: a weapon fashioned out of Kasaka’s Venom Fang. It paralyzes and causes bleeding. Kamish’s Wrath: A pair of daggers crafted from the dragon Kamish’s fang. They are mana-sensitive, which means that their user’s strength stat determines how powerful they are. They also let the user change their weight as they see fit. Knight Killer: A dagger made for combating opponents wearing armor. It increases damage against opponents wearing armor by 25%. Baruka’s Dagger: A dagger formerly wielded by Baruka, an elven warlord. https://quotetheanime.com/solo-leveling/.content: Sung Jin-Woo | Solo Leveling (WIKI) - QTA Skip to content search Categories Menu Toggle Recommendations Anime Quotes FUNNY Cosplay Theories Gaming Latest Posts Store About Us Menu Toggle Join the Team Categories Menu Toggle Recommendations Anime Quotes FUNNY Cosplay Theories Gaming Latest Posts Store About Us Menu Toggle Join the Team search Main Menu Categories Menu Toggle Recommendations Anime Quotes FUNNY Cosplay Theories Gaming Latest Posts Store About Us Menu Toggle Join the Team Sung Jin-Woo | Solo Leveling (WIKI) Wiki | INFO , Action , Solo Leveling / By Mélissa Nassif /  August 6, 2022 Sung Jin-Woo - Solo Leveling Wiki Sung Jin-Woo is the protagonist of the Manhwa “ Solo Leveling” . Sung Jin-Woo started as the weakest E-Rank Hunter, he was just a bit stronger than a normal human. He was known as “ The World’s Weakest ” (Manhwa: Chapter 1). Even at this level, he decided to work as a Hunter to cover his mother’s medical bills and his sister’s education since his father has been missing for 10 years now after entering a Gate. Table of Contents Toggle Sung Jin-Woo - Solo Leveling Wiki Table of Content History Appearance Personality Strengths and Skills Shadow Extraction Command Phrase: Arise Domain of the Monarch Save Shadow Ruler’s Authority Stealth Shadow Exchange Longevity Bloodlust Immunity Mutilation Detoxification Tenacity Vital Strike Quicksilver Critical Chain Advanced Dagger Arts Dagger Throw Jin-Woo's Weapons Kim Sangshik’s Steel Blade Knight Killer The Orb of Avarice Baruka’s Dagger Devil King's Dagger The Long Sword of the Demon King Baran Kamish’s Wrath: Jin-Woo's Equipment Warden’s Necklace High Knight’s Chestplate High Knight’s Gauntlet High Knight’s Ring High Magicien Ring Archer’s Gloves Assassin’s Boots Red Knight’s Helmet Demon Monarch's Earring Demon Monarch's Necklace Demon Monarch's Ring Potions Rasaka’s Venom Mana Potion Healing Potion Holy Water of Life Items Dungeon Key Raikan's Fang Leather Pouch Bandages Warm Fur Coat Warm Gloves Demon Castle Key Warm Fur Coat Castle Door Key Cerberus Fang Volcan’s Horn World Tree Fragment Spring Water of the Echoing Forest Purified Blood of Demon King Titles Wolf Slayer The one who overcame adversity Summons Igris Hunter Kim Chul Tusk Kaisel Beru Jima Greed Kamish Quests The Courage of the Weak Demon Castle Job Change Relationships/Family Park Kyung-Hye Sung Il-Hwan Sung Jin-Ah Cha Hae-in Yoo Jin-Ho Final Verdict References Table of Content History There are two types of people living in Solo Leveling, the first type are normal people like you and me, the others are people who were reawakened . The reawakened are called “ Hunters ” and gain enhanced physical abilities as well as unique skills . Their main job is to clear Gates that are appearing all around the world. Inside those Gates or “Dungeons” dwell monsters and demons of all kinds. To successfully clear the Gate you first need to kill the Final Boss , like in a game . If not taken care of in time, the Gate breaks , and the monsters are released into the real world. One day, his raid party and he ventured into a C-Rank Dungeon where they found a Double Gate ( Manhwa: Chap 2) . The Double Gate was at least S-Rank and a massacre was inevitable. With no way to escape nor fight back, Sung Jin-Woo on the brink of despair finally realized that the Dungeon had rules . When they were just about to make it, his comrades betrayed him and left him behind to die . Miraculously, instead of dying, he experienced a Double Awakening and acquired the “ Black Heart ” of the Shadow Monarch . He was chosen by the system to become a “ Player, ” making him the one and only Hunter with the ability to constantly evolve and level up (Manhwa: Chapter 11). This is when it all begins . Sung Jin Woo Character Info Reveal Status (Spoilers) Alive Race: Human Birth: – Death : – Affiliations: -Rulers -The System Weapons: -Daggers -Kamish’s Wrath -Knight Killer -Demon King’s Daggers -Baruka’s Dagger More Information Gender: Male Relations Family (Spoilers) Sung Il-Hwan (Fathe/Dad) Jin-Ah (Sister) Park Kyung-Hye (Mother) Sung Su-Ho (Son) Cha Hae-In (Wife) Yoo Jin-Ho (Brother In Law) Appearances in ANIME/Manga Manhwa: Chapter 1 Light Novel: Chapter 1 Appearance Sung Jin-Woo is a ravishing Hunter. Not only handsome but intelligent as well. He has jet black hair , sharp gray eyes that show no emotions , defined muscles , and a smile that in its rare appearance, can make your heart melt. He is considered averagely tall and thin . His eyes, when angry or getting serious, start to glow in a light purple color that strikes fear into anyone who meets his gaze . He is shown most of the time wearing black tracksuits or formal black tuxes . Of course, he became like this after becoming a Player. Before his awakening, he was very thin but with no muscles at all, much shorter with long messy hair , till now he always wakes up with a bedhead . He looked much younger than his actual age. Personality Sung Jin-Woo has the complete and utmost confidence in his strength and abilities . He also knows his current limit and will retreat when facing an enemy stronger than he is to take the time to level up and try again after making the necessary preparations . He fights with his fists as well as his brain to make sure to always come back to his family. He puts his family’s life and safety above all else and will leave anyone or anything behind if they are in danger . He looks and acts like a cold , serious person and will only warm up to the people who acknowledge and respect him. While fighting, he is ruthless and looks more like a monster than a human. He does not hesitate to kill monsters or humans that he considers as despicable as monsters. He doesn’t have many friends and spends most of his time in Dungeons to level up and get stronger (Manhwa: Chapter 140). He will go to great lengths for the few people he calls Friends and will risk his life for any human life. Jun-Woo can be seen as cruel and scary but he has a golden heart that cares for everybody around him. His power made him a bit arrogant , he is nothing like his shy , impressionable former self . Jin-Woo can be disrespectful to people of high status and very polite with the persons that he respects even monsters if they earn his trust like Esil, the demon girl he met during the “Demon Castle” quest (Manhwa: Chapter 82). He is brave , danger does not scare him. This is a quality that he had even before gaining power. Our MC is not materialistic and doesn’t care about money or fame . He cherishes his privacy and dislikes attention . When he cleared the Jeju Island Raid by himself, he left all the magic crystals behind so the government could use them to rebuild (Manhwa: Chapter 106). When he was in the A-Rank Dungeon and saved the “Hunters” Guild raid party, he left all the Boss’s drops to the original owners of the Dungeon, he explicitly said that he shouldn’t be too greedy and only extracted the Boss’s shadow (Manhwa: Chapter 75). He also does not care if he is thanked or rewarded for all his good deeds. He saved Yoo Jin-Ho’s father from the “ Eternal Slumber ” and kept it a secret , he also saved multiple people’s lives very discreetly and left the scenes without any second thoughts to the matter (Manhwa: Chapter 139) . His ego is so strong that even the Shadow Monarch could not take over his body and he kept his consciousness even after his Black Heart awakened (Manhwa: Chapter 130). Strengths and Skills Sung Jin-Woo is the possessor of the Black Heart , the Vessel of the strongest Monarch, the Shadow Monarch , and has his strength and abilities. He is also a Player that can constantly level up , and has no limits as Norma Selner, the “ Upgrader ” revealed when she wanted to make Jin Woo surpass his limits. (Manhwa: Chapter 109) . This makes him the strongest Hunter in the entire world. Jin-Woo even has a chance to transcend the Monarchs and the Rulers alike. Not only does he have an extremely long list of skills and abilities at his disposition he also has the equipment to go with them. Shadow Extraction No Mana is required except for the regeneration of shadows. Shadow extraction is a unique skill possessed by the Shadow Monarch. It makes any of the defeated enemies, whether they are beasts or people, and revive them in the way that they become Jin Woo’s shadows. They come back to life as shadows whose only purpose is to follow the caster’s order. The only beings who are immune to this skill are beasts with souls that are evil to infinite extents. Like, one of the BEAST monarchs that we saw in the manhwa The extraction of the shadow can fail if the corps has been dead for too long or if the target is stronger than the caster. The Shadow Soldiers are summoned directly from inside Sung’s shadow and they are immortal. As long as he has Mana he can regenerate them indefinitely. He can also assign his Soldier to dwell inside other people’s shadows for protection, espionage are surprising attacks. Furthermore, every single shadow can level up and gain more power as they go to battle, most of them are now stronger than their original self Command Phrase: Arise Domain of the Monarch This power is a straight killer. Domain of the Monarch is such an overpowered ability that anyone in an RPG game will die to have. With the use of this power, Jin-Woo can temporarily increase the strength of his army, making them stronger and faster than they already were. Save Shadow No Mana Required. The ability to save the shadow that he extracted Ruler’s Authority A Pyro ability that allows Jin-Woo to control any objects even when he isn’t present. This gives him an edge over a lot of other strong characters. Stealth 200 Mana to extinguish all traces of you, 10 Mana per second to hide instantly . Stealth is an Assassin’s ability that hides away everything. It’s like, Jin-Woo didn’t even exist. From the smell to sound, he becomes a NINJA beast. Shadow Exchange Sung Jin-Woo can teleport himself and exchange bodies with any of the shadow soldiers no matter where they arc. This was seen multiple times in the Manhwa. Longevity Using Longevity , Jin-Woo won’t be affected by things like poison , and other substances that will cause harm to his body. Bloodlust Jin-Woo would kick the guy down. Effect “Fear” -50% of all stats. Immunity This will make Jin-Woo against all the critical hits or debuffs that cause problems to the player’s abilities. Mutilation Using a Dagger, Sung Woo can rip ANYONE into pieces. Detoxification Detoxification removes every harmful substance that will harm Jin-Woo’s body. Tenacity Using a Dagger, Sung Woo can rip ANYONE into pieces. Vital Strike 70 Mana. Using a Dagger, you learn to attack efficiently and deal critical damage to vital areas. Type: Ingredient Titles Wolf Slayer This title was given to Sung-Woo after he mastered the art of killing wolves. But it has its benefits. The Wolf Slayer title increases Jin-Woo’s proficiency by 40% if he’s fighting a beast. (Manhwa: Chapter 14) The one who overcame adversity A title given to those who persevere and fight against the odds heroically. Your stats will increase according to the health that you lost during the battle. +1% stat every -1% HP (Manhwa: Chapter 45) Summons Igris He is the shadow extracted from the defeated Blood-Red Commander Igris during the Job Change Quest (Manhwa: Chapter 40) He was upgraded and given the title Elite Knight. He is on the level of an S-Rank Hunter and he is the second strongest summon after Beru. Abilities Dominator’s Touch Regeneration Tank: He is the shadow of the alpha of the ice bears that Jin-Woo faced and defeated in a Red-Gate during the recruit training of the “ Tiger ” Guild (Manhwa: Chapter 51) . He was upgraded to the title of “ Knight ” and can be considered as strong as an A-Rank Hunter. Hunter Kim Chul Abilities Regeneration Iron: He is the shadow of A-Rank Hunter Kim Chul, one of the recruits of the “Tiger” Guild that was trapped in the Red-Gate with Sung Jin-Woo. He died because of Sung’s scheme. Sung purposely tries to make him attack at an unreasonable moment so he would die and be turned into a shadow (Manhwa: Chapter 54) . Like Igris he possesses the Title of “Elite Knight” and the power that rivals an S-Rank. Tusk This summon is the shadow of Kargalgan, the Final Boss of the A-Rank Dungeon that Sung Jin-Woo entered as a porter with the “Hunters” Guild (Manhwa: Chapter 75) . He is at the S-Rank level and has the widest set of abilities. He can attack and defend. A great Magician that turned out to be an invaluable asset. Abilities Levitation: He can levitate any target and uses this power as a weapon by slamming and crashing his enemies on hard surfaces Regeneration Hymn of Protection: He can materialize a shield to protect himself, the person of his choice or trap his enemies in it. Hymn of the Fire Dragon: The ability to shoot fire from his mouth. Hymn of the Blazing Fire: Fires multiple fireballs simultaneously. Hymn of Agony: A curse that will conjure agonizing pain upon his enemies. Hymn of Frenzy: The ability to weaken his opponent’s defenses. Hymn of Blindness: A curse that will completely bring down his target. Hymn of Slumber: A curse that will slowly drain the target’s stamina. Hymn of Petrification: The ability to petrify his enemies. Hymn of Rage Hymn of Strengthening: The ability to increase his, or a person of his choice, strength. Hymn of Giants: Tusk can increase his size and turn into a Giant. Hymn of Combustion Kaisel Kaisel is a dragon or a wyvern, his real name was Kaisellin and he was King Baran’s servant and mount (Manhwa: Chapter 88) . He is now the main mode of transportation of Sung Jin-Woo. He is able to travel colossal miles at astonishing speed and because he is a shadow he never gets tired. His strength is not to be taken lightly. Abilities Unknown Beru He is the shadow extracted from the Ant King during the Jeju Island Raid. He is the strongest shadow possessed by Sung-Jin-Woo and the only one with the ability to talk. He gained the title of “Marshal” and can be considered a class above S-Rank (Manhwa: Chapter 105). Regeneration Gluttony: The ability to steal the skill of his defeated opponents Flight Size Manipulation : By increasing his size, by sacrificing a bit of speed and agility he can gain strength. The opposite also works. By decreasing his size and sacrificing strength he can gain more agility and speed. Paralysis Poison: Spit a poison so toxic that it can kill his opponent in a matter of seconds. Healing Magic More Beru Info Jima He is Boss Naga’s shadow. The first Boss that Sung Jin-Woo defeated during his first official Raid after he established his own Guild (Manhwa: Chapter 122) . Sung stated that he is as strong as Tusk which makes him S-Rank level. Abilities Growth Regeneration Greed Greed: He is the shadow of Hwang Dong-Su, an S-Rank Hunter that ignited Sung Jin-Woo’s wrath after beating to death his Vice-Guild Master and the person he considers his younger brother, Yoo Jin-Ho. He was killed by Sung’s hands and turned into a shadow as punishment (Manhwa: Chapter 147) . He owns the Rank of “General” and in terms of sheer strength, he is only surpassed by Beru. Abilities Conversation Regeneration Kamish Kamish is humanity’s worst calamity. He is the monster that broke out of the first S-Rank Gate that ever appeared. Kamish devastated American’s Coasts, killed five S-Rank Hunters, and the National Level Hunters still tremble in remembrance of the event. His magic power is overwhelming and his strength cannot even be described. Sung Jin-Woo managed to extract his shadow but only for a few minutes as too much time had passed before he did so (Manhwa: Chapter 143). Abilities Colossal Physical Strength Conversation Dragon’s Fear Dragon’s Breath: Shooting fire from his mouth Quests The Courage of the Weak Sung had to clear that quest when he was still the weakest E-Rank Hunter, an S-Rank Quest that he miraculously survived and cleared . This is the quest he found in the Double Dungeon and the Quest that made him a “ Player ”. Demon Castle During this Quest, aside from obtaining great equipment and making the acquaintance of a Monster called Esil, and befriending her, he found the recipe for the Holy Water of Life that woke her mother from the eternal slumber . Job Change The Job Change Quest, after clearing it, gave him the job of a Necromancer , the Necromancer job was soon updated to Shadow Monarch . This Quest is what gave him the ability to become a One-Man Guild and the King of the immortal Shadow Army . STRONGEST Solo Leveling Characters Relationships/Family Park Kyung-Hye She is Sung Jin- Woo’s mother and the main reason why he decided to work as Hunter. She was struck by the disease “Eternal Slumber”. As the name suggests, it puts the affected in a sort of coma that they cannot rise from. They have to stay connected to a very expensive machine to stay alive. During the Demon Castle Quest, Sung found a recipe for the Holy Water of Life , a potion that can cure any illness and he saved his mother after defeating Baran , one of the Monarchs. When she opened her eyes the first thing she did was thank his son for taking such good care of his sister all on his own. More Park Kyung-Hye Sung Il-Hwan He is Sung Jin-Woo’s father and he disappeared in a Dungeon 10 years ago. He reappeared in a Gate in America with the magical energy of a Monster . He turned out to be one of the Rulers Vessels . Because he is aware of the power he possesses he can use the full power of his fragment. He also has extensive knowledge of the situation and what might happen in the future. He is also aware that his son is the Shadow Monarch even if he never left the Dungeon in the 10 years he was missing. Because of his disappearance , Sung had to take his place and take care of his family , a task that was not a walk in the park with the level that he was at in the beginning. More Sung Il-Hwan Sung Jin-Ah She is Sung’s sister . She is the one who chose the Guild name, “ AhJin ”, her Chapter name in reverse . In her eyes, Sung was like a father . He was the one she relied on to protect her and he was the one attending the parent-professors meeting. Her love for him is only matched by the reciprocated love her brother has for her. When she was attacked by orcs at her school, and Sung was in a Raid , he left everything and rushed to her side to rescue her. When he saw that the orcs dared to touch her, he entered a state of pure rage that even Beeru could sense from the Dungeon he was still in. Cha Hae-in A lot of girls had their sights on Sung, but the only one he ever showed any interest in was Hunter Cha, an S-Rank Hunter that he first met during a Raid where he posed as a porter . Cha has a very sensitive nose and cannot stand the stench of Monsters and Hunters alike, the only person she can smell and even like his odor is Sung’s . When she witnessed his strength her curiosity towards him turn into a romantic interest. She even wanted to leave the “Hunter’s” Guild and her position and Vice-Guild Master to enter Sung’s Guild instead. He also considers her a friend and the only person he can think of when he wants to do something mundane. He invited her to go to the amusement park where his father disappeared and showed her magnificent views on a ride on Kaisel . More Cha Hae In Yoo Jin-Ho He is the Vice-Guild Master of Sung’s Guild. He is the first person who saw what Sung was capable of. During the first Raid they went together, the other Guild members turned on Sung and wanted to kill him, Yoo knew that Sung was stronger than he was and even so, he decided to protect him. His kind heart is what made Sung so fond of him. When he confessed that he looked at Sung like an older brother , Sung decided to consider him his younger brother as well. Furthermore, when his father offered him to become the Guild Master of the Guild he was creating, he refused to be the right hand of Sung instead. Final Verdict Although one of the main antagonists of the Tokyo Revengers Series, Izana Kurokawa is undoubtedly a very interesting character. It would come as a shock to some readers when they find out that Mikey has a half-brother and they would eventually go head to head. Izana Kurokawa has a substantial influence on the series, especially in how Takemichi will try to fix the past. References 1. Chapter 1 2. Chapter 11 3. Chapter 14 4. Chapter 17 5. Chapter 34 6. Powers & abilities explained by Aparna Ukil Published: Jan 07, 2024, 11:27 Save for later Save for later Sung Jin-Woo is a manhwa character in Solo Leveling who appears extremely weak in the beginning. However, his encounter with a powerful entity called ‘God’ changes his life by providing him with the abilities he always lacked as a hunter. Here’s everything you should know about Solo Leveling’s main protagonist. The long-awaited anime adaptation of the popular Korean manhwa has premiered globally and it has everything that we could’ve asked for, be it the top-level visual dynamics or the gripping narrative. Article continues after ad Solo Leveling follows Sung Jin-Woo, who comes out to be frail and the weakest protagonist at the start. However, over time Jin-Woo’s powers start enhancing mysteriously and he becomes a one-man army who is impossible to defeat. So, who is Sung Jin-Woo and what powers and abilities does he boast? Let’s find out. Who is Sung Jin-Woo? When the story of Solo Leveling commences, we meet a hunter named Sung Jin-Woo, who is known as ‘Humanity’s Weakest Hunter’. Even though he lacks physical strength, his strong wit since the beginning saved the remaining members from getting killed in their first Dungeon. Article continues after ad Article continues after ad The story introduces him as an E-rank hunter who hasn’t come uninjured out of any battle. He is someone who gets knocked out even by the weakest monsters. However, things change for him when he almost gets brutally killed at a Dungeon where he loses a major part of his party. Apparently, his party enters a Dungeon thinking that it’s an E-Class mission but turns out that it is an S-Class Dungeon. Solo Leveling Episode 1 Looks so good! 🔥 #SoloLeveling pic.twitter.com/aTQm98hKzt — Khalid (@Rm_5aled) January 6, 2024 When we thought this was his end, the young hunter awakens only to stun everyone with the newly found abilities granted to him by ‘God’. He gets to access a mysterious gaming-like interface called System that becomes visible only to his eyes. Related Solo Leveling: Arise codes (January 2025) – How to redeem, Draw Tickets & Gold Article continues after ad The platform gives him the ability to get stronger over time, very much like an RPG game , where he has to perform different tasks and fight monsters to level up. He also gets access to multiple new weapons during his quest to become the strongest Hunter. Article continues after ad What are Sung Jin-Woo’s powers & abilities? After coming across the System, Sung Jin-Woo gets an exceptional hold on his speed and physical strength. The one who was once mocked for being a good-for-nothing hunter by every member of his party eventually becomes an unstoppable being who is enough to take a bunch of monsters down on his own. Thanks to the potent RPG-like interface that helps him level up with each successful quest. Article continues after ad The System The System lets Sung Jin-Woo keep track of the status of his physical/mental health, energy, necromancy, and more. He can also stay aware of how much inventory he is left with, how much of his powers have been upgraded or what are his achievements. Shadows Sung Jin-Woo also has the potential to turn the defeated opponents into his allies (known as Shadows), who help him in the battles using the powers that they had before getting knocked down. Adding to that, he can also store the Shadows and use/diminish their existence at his will. Article continues after ad Article continues after ad Manhwa readers know that this  Anime is going to break the internet 🔥 #SoloLeveling pic.twitter.com/Hn2Ew2GppW — ᗩᑎIᗰE ᕼᑌᗷ 👑 (@AnimeHubDaily) January 5, 2024 Ruler’s Authority Using the Ruler’s Authority, he can use the Shadows to craft weapons or increase his movements. In short, Jin-Woo can store his army and weapons in his Shadow, which allows him to summon his soldiers or access any of his weapons out of nowhere. Healing Moreover, with all these powers comes the healing ability that allows him to regenerate from the most severe injuries in no time. In the final stages of the story, Sung Jin-Woo becomes the one with God-like abilities that grant him the potency to even bring the dead back to life. Article continues after ad Stealth That’s not the end of Jin-Woo’s abilities as he can also execute stealth attacks by erasing his presence. So, it becomes almost impossible for any opponent to detect Jin-Woo, and they become easy prey for our overpowered protagonist. Jin-Woo’s abilities are limited when he starts using “The System” granted by the “God.” He gets very few resources and has to perform every task carefully. But over time, Jin-Woo gathers several resources and reaches a level where he can control entire Shadow armies and even alter reality. In the end, Jin-Woo becomes a supernatural entity who can even defeat “Gods.” Article continues after ad Article continues after ad Finally got to watch Solo Leveling & first episode is beautifully adapted. I'm genuinely impressed with how the action scenes turned out. Plus the additions to story, visuals & music is pretty good too Its listed for 12 episodes & I pray they don't rush it like God of Highschool pic.twitter.com/kQhCBirBx9 — Myamura (@Go_Jover) January 7, 2024 Of course, fans who read the Korean Manhwa know all about Jin-Woo’s long yet fascinating journey. However, anime-only fans have yet to see Jin-Woo becoming an indestructible force who’s fighting on Humanity’s behalf. In the initial phase of Jin-Woo’s journey, you’ll see him accepting his newly found powers and being as sensitive and considerate as always, but after a few episodes , Jin-Woo will turn into someone else entirely.
